com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.domains

Class JointDomainReindexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.domains.JointDomainReindexer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChainedJointDomainReindexer, JointDomainIndexConditioner, JointDomainIndexJoiner, JointDomainIndexPermuter

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class JointDomainReindexer
extends java.lang.Object
    Supports conversion of indexes between two JointDomainIndexers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JointDomainReindexer.Indices
      A set of domain indexes sized appropriately for a single JointDomainReindexer.Indices.converter for use in conversion computation.

    • Method Detail

      • createConditioner

        public static JointDomainReindexer createConditioner(JointDomainIndexer fromDomains,
                                     int[] valueIndices)
        Creates a converter that removes domains conditioned on the specified value indices.

        Parameters:
        fromDomains -
        valueIndices - is an array of length equal to size of fromDomains. Each entry is either a negative value to indicate that that dimension will be retained in the new graph or an index value that is valid for that dimension that indicates the value to be conditioned on.
        Since:
        0.05

      • createPermuter

        public static JointDomainReindexer createPermuter(JointDomainIndexer fromDomains,
                                  @Nullable
                                  JointDomainIndexer addedDomains,
                                  JointDomainIndexer toDomains,
                                  @Nullable
                                  JointDomainIndexer removedDomains,
                                  int[] oldToNewIndex)
        Creates a converter that implements a permutation of the domains in fromDomains and addedDomains into ToDomains and removedDomains.

        The total number of domains in the from+added domains must equal those in to+removed domains.

        Parameters:
        fromDomains - must be non-null
        addedDomains - may be null
        toDomains - must be non-null
        removedDomains - may be null
        oldToNewIndex - maps the index of the old domain to the index of the new domain where the index of domains in fromDomains are in the range [0,fromSize-1] and the index of domains in addedDomains is in the range [fromSize, totalSize-1]. Likewise the domains in toDomains and removeDomains are in the range [0, toSize-1] and [toSize, totalSize - 1]. The mapping must not omit or repeat elements and may not map domains of different sizes.

      • createPermuter

        public static JointDomainReindexer createPermuter(JointDomainIndexer fromDomains,
                                  JointDomainIndexer toDomains,
                                  int[] oldToNewIndex)
        Creates a converter that implements a permutation of the domains in fromDomains to those in toDomains.

        This implementation will invoke createPermuter(JointDomainIndexer, JointDomainIndexer, JointDomainIndexer, JointDomainIndexer, int[]) after calculating the addedDomains and removedDomains arguments.

        There are three cases:

        fromDomains and toDomains have the same size.
        The oldToNewIndex must also be the same size. The addedDomains and removedDomains arguments will be null.
        fromDomains is smaller than toDomains
        It is necessary to deduce the addedDomains. If oldToNewIndex is the same length as toDomains it specifies how the added domains should be chosen from toDomains. If it is the same length as fromDomains then the addedDomains will be chosen from the remaining toDomains that are not in the index in order.
        fromDomains is larger than toDomains
        The oldToNewIndex must be the same size as fromDomains. It is necessary to deduce the removedDomains.

      • createPermuter

        public static JointDomainReindexer createPermuter(JointDomainIndexer fromDomains,
                                  JointDomainIndexer toDomains)
        Creates a converter to convert fromDomains to toDomains while maintaining the same domain order. This can be used to convert between domain lists with different input/output domain sets.

      • createPermuter

        public static JointDomainReindexer createPermuter(JointDomainIndexer fromDomains,
                                  int[] oldToNew)
        Creates a converter to convert fromDomains by permuting the order of its domains according to the oldToNew mapping.
        Parameters:
        fromDomains -
        oldToNew - must have the same length as the size of fromDomains and must contain integers in the range [0,size-1] with no duplicates.
        Since:
        0.05

      • getFromDomains

        public final JointDomainIndexer getFromDomains()

      • getScratch

        public final JointDomainReindexer.Indices getScratch()
        Returns an "scratch" instance of JointDomainReindexer.Indices for use in conversion computations.

        If the instance is later released via JointDomainReindexer.Indices.release() then that instance may be returned by a future invocation of this method.

      • getToDomains

        public final JointDomainIndexer getToDomains()
        Returns JointDomainIndexer for factor table to be converted to. Will never be null.

      • convertIndices

        public abstract void convertIndices(JointDomainReindexer.Indices indices)

        Default computation of hashCode()

      • maintainsJointIndexOrder

        protected abstract boolean maintainsJointIndexOrder()
        True if converter maintains the same order of joint indexes such that if oldA <= oldB, then newA <= newB. Used to avoid sorting when converting sparse indices.

        True only if all removals are at front of list, additions are at end of list and relative order of domains is otherwise maintained.

        public double[] sparseCopy(double[] oldValues,
                  int[] oldSparseIndexToJointIndex,
                  int[] sparseIndexToJointIndex)
